Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a situation where two people need to communicate over a long distance using a string telephone.
The student can illustrate a basic string telephone design connecting two students with cups and a string.
The student can demonstrate the use of provided materials in their design by clearly showing cups and strings.
The student can label most parts of the drawing to indicate which parts send and receive sound.
The student can highlight the string telephone's role in helping people communicate over distances with some detail.
The student can use arrows or symbols to show sound movement through the string in a mostly correct manner.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label the drawing, missing one or two elements (e.g., labels might not clearly differentiate between sender and receiver).
The student may not fully illustrate the mechanics of how sound travels through the string (e.g., omitting an arrow or using a less clear symbol to represent sound movement).
